forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 44. South southeast wind 21 to 30 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 56. West southwest wind 18 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night deepens over Downtown San Francisco, the air is thick with the promise of rain, shrouding the city in a damp embrace. The relentless south-southeast winds howl against the grit of the streets, stirring the droplets to dance along pavement and rooftops. With a forecast that echoes the sentiment of heavy skies, the chance of precipitation hangs at a weighty 100%. Tomorrow’s light may struggle, dimly peeking through a tangle of clouds, as temperatures strive to reach an unexciting 56 degrees while the probing winds continue to unsettle the urban quiet.

For those daring to venture out into this swirl of chilly rain and blustery gusts, it would be prudent to don a solid rain jacket and sturdy waterproof footwear, lest one become caught unprepared by the elements. Embrace an indoor adventure, perhaps exploring a tucked-away café adorned with local art, or lose yourself in the pages of a well-thumbed book in the soft light of a nearby library. While outdoor pursuits may remain elusive in this blustery embrace, the social warmth of a cozy gathering or the charm of a quiet evening indoors could transform this wet spell into a moment of reflection and comfort, a reminder of simple joys amid the storm.
